category.motivation: ESA leaders’ remarks at the Living Planet Symposium represent an official policy statement on collaboration and industry direction.

article_node.title: European space tech has data to sell — but where are the buyers?
article_node.summary: The European space industry is experiencing significant growth, particularly in Earth observation, but faces challenges in commercializing valuable data. At the Living Planet Symposium 2025, ESA leaders emphasized the need for collaboration with the private sector to bridge gaps in data utilization. Despite successful missions like the Φsat-2 satellite, many startups struggle to monetize their data due to disconnects within the industry and a lack of understanding among potential commercial users. As Europe aims to enhance its position in the global space economy, innovative companies are emerging to leverage satellite data for various applications, highlighting the importance of integrating space technology into terrestrial sectors.
